Review:
A great spot to grab a coffee at the International Airport. It is located in The Quad area as soon as you exit the airport. There is good amount of seating. 

The food is alright, but I prefer the coffees here. They are made quickly and the staff are very kind if you want it heated more or you want some change in it. The place is also reasonably priced for an airport cafe. 

Overall a good experience here.
Hospitable service staff. I asked if there was a lounge they happily said I could sit there till my flight. Had some grub. Very decent people so I did  not mind the price.
nice waiting place while your taxi arrives..

24 hours opening Cafe 77 at Taj Hotel 
Food very Tasteful
Good service, opposite to the Indigo check-in counters inside the airport, bit dirty in some areas.
Good vibes. Coffee, not so good for the price.

Apart from Mumbai airport CCd this is one of the most beautifully done CCd. Loved the layout,  sitting and the entire ambience here. Amazing coffee point. Don't book a cab if u want to enjoy a coffee once done then book. Uber zone is just next to this place and ola is in front walking. And they are open 24x7 , serving great lunch from 11 to 3pm for just Rs. 375
For a quick bite while inside the Airport.

Café Coffee Day (CCD) is an Indian café chain. It is a subsidiary of Coffee Day Enterprises Limited. Coffee Day serves 1.8 billion cups of coffee annually in six countries
Café Coffee Day Global Limited Company is a Chikkamagaluru-based business which grows coffee in its own estates of 20,000 acres. It is the largest producer of arabica beans in Asia, exporting to various countries including the U.S., Europe, and Japan.

V. G. Siddhartha started the café chain in 1996 when he incorporated Coffee Day Global, which is the parent of the Coffee Day chain. The first CCD outlet was set up on July 11, 1996, at Brigade Road, Bangalore, Karnataka. It rapidly expanded to other cities in India, with more than 1000 cafés open across the nation by 2011.

In 2010, it was announced that a consortium led by Kohlberg Kravis Roberts would invest ₹10 billion (US$140 million) in Coffee Day Resorts, owned by the company.The same year, the logo was changed to the current logo, which the company stated was to showcase the chain as a place to talk.This was done with major changes in the layout of the stores, including the addition of lounges and a total revamp of the interiors.
The staffs are courteous and are helpful too. Their setting is good. They offer spacious seating. The overall ambiance is good and colorful.
